channel.title: Categorization on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Categorization on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Levenshtein distance for approximate match
item.description: The problem, simply stated, is that of typoes and inconsistent spelling and pluraliziation. Let’s say you have a collection of text that you want to annotate with some metadata, like categories and tags. You don’t want to set aside ahead of time exactly which tags you want to use, but you want to catch through some test or lint step that you’ve done something wrong by typing “apples” into a field that really has “apple” most of the time.
